snippet: Three networks were accused of violating rules by showing interviews that criticized the execution of Yakub Memon for the 1993 Mumbai bombings.
abstract: India’s Ministry of Information and Broadcasting accuses NDTV, ABP News and Aaj Tak television networks of violating regulations by showing interviews criticizing July 2015 execution of Yakub Memom, perpetrator in 1993 Mumbai bombings that killed 257 people; increasing number of people believe government is trying to gain greater control over what is watched and read.
lead_paragraph: Three networks were accused of violating rules by showing interviews that criticized the execution of Yakub Memon for the 1993 Mumbai bombings.

headline.main: India Warns TV Stations Over Criticism of Hanging
headline.print_headline: India Warns TV Stations Over Criticism of Hanging
